keyTakeAways: Gov. Josh Shapiro is releasing a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service' on January 27, 2025.
The book details Shapiro’s political rise, personal trauma from a fire at his mansion in April 2024, and his faith and family life.
The incident where a man set fire to the governor’s mansion while Shapiro and his family were sleeping was a significant personal event that shapes the book’s narrative.
Cody Balmer pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder in connection with the fire and was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison under a plea deal.
Shapiro was considered a potential running mate for Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election and is seen as a prominent figure in the Democratic Party for the 2028 election cycle.
HarperCollins Publishers, through its Harper imprint, is releasing the book, indicating a major publishing partnership with a widely recognized national publisher.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro is set to release a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service' on January 27, 2025, through Harper, an imprint of HarperCollins Publishers. The book chronicles his political rise, personal trauma from a fire that set his mansion on fire in April 2024 while he and his family were sleeping, and his journey of faith and community service. The incident, linked to Cody Balmer, who pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder and received a 25 to 50-year prison sentence, deeply influenced Shapiro’s narrative. The book is significant not only as a personal memoir but also as a reflection of Shapiro’s national political profile, including his consideration as a potential running mate for Kamala Harris in 2024 and his status as a rising figure in the Democratic Party for the 2028 presidential race.
title: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro to Release Memoir on Trauma, Faith, and Public Service
